required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Shingrix in Patients With Rheumatic Diseases: a Double-blind Placebo-controlled RCT
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of a Recombinant Subunit Herpes Zoster Vaccine in Patients With Rheumatic Diseases Undergoing Immunosuppressive or Biologic/Targeted DMARD Therapies: a Double-blind Randomized Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A double-blind randomized controlled trial on the safety and immunogenicity of the recombinant subunit herpes zoster vaccine, Shingrix, in patients with rheumatic diseases undergoing immunosuppressive or biologic/targeted DMARD therapies

detailed_description.textblock:
A double-blind randomized controlled trial on the safety and immunogenicity of the recombinant subunit herpes zoster vaccine, Shingrix, in patients with rheumatic diseases undergoing immunosuppressive or biologic/targeted DMARD therapies.
Duration of study: 60 weeks

study_design_info.masking_description: double-blind for the identity of the drugs

primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients with 4x fold increase in anti-gE antibody titer

secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients with 4x fold increase in anti-gE antibody titer
in 40 patients (20 from each arm); number of IFNγ-secreting CD4+ T cell colonies on ELISPOT assay

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with a diagnosis of rheumatic or immune-mediated diseases eg. systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, spondyloarthritis, inflammatory myopathies, ANCA-related and large vessel vasculitides
2. Age ≥18 years
3. Active disease requiring the following immunosuppressive regimens:
1. Prednisolone ≥0.6mg/kg/day ± intravenous pulse methylprednisolone, mycophenolate mofetil or the calcineurin inhibitors
2. Cyclophosphamide (intravenous pulses or daily oral)
3. B-cell depleting biological agents eg. rituximab, belimumab
4. Anti-TNFα biological agents eg. infliximab, etanercept, adalimumab, golimumab, certolizumab
5. Anti-interleukin-6 biological agents eg. tocilizumab, sarilumab
6. Other biological agents eg. abatacept, ustekinumab, secukinumab, ixekizumab
7. The Janice kinase inhibitors (JAKis) eg. tofacitinib, baricitinib, upadacitinib, filgotinib
4. Female patients with reproductive potential are allowed to participate in this study provided that they are willing to practice contraception for until at least 12 months after vaccination
5. Willing to comply with all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Active infection, including upper respiratory tract infection
2. Active herpes zoster infection
3. Active untreated tuberculosis
4. Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
5. History of HZ or varicella vaccination in the past
6. History of allergy to any vaccines
7. Patients who are pregnant or plan to become pregnancy within one year of study entry
8. Pregnant or lactating women
9. Patients who cannot give a written consent (mentally incapable or illiterate)

facility.name: Department of Medicine, Tuen Mun Hospital
